p: Native and non‐native plant communities also differed in the composition of bees they attracted. For example, honeybees ( A. mellifera) or the sweat bee L. tegulare were more abundant on non‐native plants than on native plants, while other polylectic bees, such as X. virginica or L. trigeminum, were more abundant on native than on non‐native plants. This result supports previous findings showing bee species‐specific responses to non‐native plants (Pardee & Philpott, 2014; Schweiger et al., 2010; Urbanowicz et al., 2020), which may be due to species‐specific nutritional requirements (Leonhardt & Blüthgen, 2012; Nicolson, 2011; Vaudo et al., 2016), previous experiences (Harmon‐Threatt & Kremen, 2015; Vaudo et al., 2015), or competition (Somme et al., 2015; Wilms et al., 1996).
